memo:
BILL NUMBER:S1894

TITLE OF BILL:
An act
to amend the domestic relations law, in relation to who may adopt a
person

PURPOSE:
This bill amends the domestic relations law provision on who may
adopt, by clarifying that permanent impairment or incapacitation of
one spouse shall not preclude adoption by the husband and wife or the
competent spouse.

SUMMARY OF PROVISIONS:
Amends section 110 of the domestic relations law is amended by adding
the following: The permanent impairment or incapacitation of one
spouse shall not preclude a husband and wife from adopting together
or the competent spouse from adopting as a single parent

JUSTIFICATION:
Section 110 currently states, it shall be unlawful to preclude a
prospective adoptive parent or parents solely on the basis that the
adopter or adopters has had, or has cancer or any other disease.
Nothing herein shall prevent the rejection of a prospective applicant
based upon his or her poor health or limited life expectancy. This
legislation makes clear that the incapacitation of one spouse shall
not disqualify prospective adoptive parents.

LEGISLATIVE HISTORY:
03/16/09 REFERRED TO CHILDREN AND FAMILIES
01/06110 REFERRED TO CHILDREN AND FAMILIES

FISCAL IMPLICATIONS:
None.

EFFECTIVE DATE:
This act shall take effect immediately.
